Package pacman.model

Class Ghost

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class Ghost
extends MovableGrid
implements java.lang.Runnable

    Ghost

    A Ghost is a MovableGrid in a Map. It can move randomly. When it touches the Pacman, it will ask GameManager to handle the some consequences.

    This class extends MovableGrid and implements Runnable.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Song Zhang
    See Also:
    MovableGrid, Runnable, Map, Direction

    • Field Detail

      • direction

        private Direction direction
        The current direction this ghost moving towards. This is used in findDirectionToMove() to prevent moving back unexpectedly.

      • timeWalked

        private int timeWalked
        The time counter recording how long the ghost walks. This is used for throttling in handleMove(Direction).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ghost

        public Ghost​(Map map,
             double row,
             double column)
        Allocates a new Ghost object.

        This constructor sets the Ghost in the given position of the given Map, sets a random image of Ghost, and gives a initial Direction.UP to move to.

        Parameters:
        map - the Map where this Ghost stays
        row - the row index in the Map where this Ghost stays, starting from 0
        column - the column index in the Map where this Ghost stays, starting from 0

    • Method Detail

      • moveTo

        private void moveTo​(Direction direction)
        Moves to a given Direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - a direction indicating where to go

      • findDirectionToMove

        private Direction findDirectionToMove()
        Returns a Direction indicating a possible way to move to.

        This method first gets all possible directions (without the current and the opposite one) to move, and randomly pick a direction to return. If there is no possible direction to move, returns the opposite direction. Otherwise, keeps moving.

        Returns:
        a Direction indicating a possible way to move to

      • moveToAnotherDirection

        private void moveToAnotherDirection()
        Moves to another direction randomly.

        This method calls findDirectionToMove() to find a direction first, then stops the current moving by calling freeze(), and calls moveTo(Direction).

      • checkTouchingPacman

        private void checkTouchingPacman()
        Tests if this Ghost is touching the Pacman. If true, calls GameManager.handleGhostTouched(Ghost).

      • handleMove

        public void handleMove​(Direction direction)
        This method overrides MovableGrid.handleMove(Direction). This is called when the moving happens.

        This method calls moveToAnotherDirection() every 10 times it is called, and calls checkTouchingPacman() always.

        Overrides:
        handleMove in class MovableGrid
        Parameters:
        direction - the current direction of moving
        See Also:
        handleMove(Direction), Pacman.handleMove(Direction)

      • handleCantMove

        public void handleCantMove​(Direction direction)
        This method overrides MovableGrid.handleMove(Direction). This is called when the moving cannot happen.

        This method calls moveToAnotherDirection().

        Overrides:
        handleCantMove in class MovableGrid
        Parameters:
        direction - the current direction of moving
        See Also:
        handleCantMove(Direction)

      • run

        public void run()
        This method overrides Runnable.run().

        This method calls moveTo(Direction) to start the moving.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • freeze

        public void freeze()
        Freezes this Ghost. I.e. Stops the moving.

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Returns the value of Score of this Ghost.

        Note: currently the value is constant as 5.

        Returns:
        the value of Score of this Ghost
